channel.title: Agents on thingsithinkithink
channel.description: Recent content in Agents on thingsithinkithink

item.title: LLM Evals Course Lesson 6: Complex Pipelines and CI/CD
item.description:
The sixth lesson of Hamel Husain and Shreya Shankar’s LLM evaluation course wrapped up unfinished material from lesson 5 (evaluating complex architectures like RAG systems and tool calling) before moving into production concerns. We covered debugging agentic pipelines, handling complex data modalities, and implementing CI/CD for LLM applications.

Debugging Multi-Step and Agentic Pipelines

Complex agentic applications have specific kinds of debugging challenges. You don’t know where to begin with error analysis when you have no idea what your agent is doing. It’s calling tools, invoking functions, making plans - and you need to figure out where to focus your efforts.

item.title: The Decade of Agents: Swyx's AI Engineer Paris Keynote
item.description:
The Decade of Agents: Swyx’s AI Engineer Paris Keynote

At AI Engineer Paris, Swyx (Shawn Wang) laid out his case for why we’re entering not just the year of AI agents, but an entire decade of agent-driven transformation from 2025 to 2035. His keynote updated his earlier AI World Fair talk with several converging trends that make this more than typical Silicon Valley optimism.

I wanted to capture the things that stuck with me from the talk. These stood out:
